name: Brotchan Roy
description: Brotchan roy, a thick broth, is an old Dublin favorite traditionally served with Irish soda bread.
keywords: beef broth, leek, steel-cut oats, high fiber, main course, spring
recipeIngredient: 4 tablespoons old-fashioned Irish oatmeal (not instant or quick-cooking)
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In two-quart saucepan melt butter and saute oats 5 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally.
Pour broth or milk into pot and bring to boil, stirring constantly.
Add remaining ingredients except parsley, lower heat and cook 30 to 50 minutes until thickened, stirring occasionally.
Puree in blender or food processor and serve in small bowls topped with parsley.
